project.name: spree-ember-checkouts
project.description: Checkout functionality for a Spree Ember Application.

CurrentOrderSupportMixin.name: CurrentOrderSupportMixin
CurrentOrderSupportMixin.description:
Provides Current Order and Checkout Functionality to the Spree service.  This
mixin is applied to the Spree service when spree-ember-checkouts initializes,
therefore all functionality described here is available like so:

```javascript
this.spree.addToCart(variantModel, 5);
```

OrderSerializer.name: OrderSerializer
OrderSerializer.description:
The Order Serializer converts the Order model into a JSON payload as dictated 
by Spree's "Checkouts" endpoint.  The payload is dependant on the state of the 
order.

Checkouts.name: Checkouts

classitems.description: A generic event triggered whenever a Spree Server request fails.
classitems.name: serverError

params.name: error
params.description: The error object returned from the Spree Server.

classitems.description: Triggered whenever a Line Item is created or updated.
classitems.name: didAddToCart

classitems.description: Triggered whenever a Line Item is created or updated.
classitems.name: addToCartFailed

classitems.description: Triggered whenever a new Order is created for the checkout user.
classitems.name: didCreateNewOrder

classitems.description: Triggered whenever a new Order is created for the checkout user.
classitems.name: newOrderCreateFailed

classitems.description: Triggered whenever a new Order is created for the checkout user.
classitems.name: didClearCurrentOrder

classitems.description: Triggered whenever the Current Order changes State.
classitems.name: checkoutStateDidChange

classitems.description: Triggered when the `_saveCurrentOrder` call succeeds.
classitems.name: didSaveCurrentOrder

params.name: currentOrderPromise
params.description:
A promise that resolves to 
the Current Order

classitems.description: Triggered when the `_saveCurrentOrder` call fails.
classitems.name: saveCurrentOrderFailed

classitems.description: Triggered when the `advanceCurrentOrder` call succeeds.
classitems.name: didAdvanceCurrentOrder

params.name: currentOrderPromise
params.description:
A promise that resolves to 
the Current Order

classitems.description: Triggered when the `advanceCurrentOrder` call fails.
classitems.name: advanceCurrentOrderFailed

classitems.description: Triggered whenever the Current Order reached it's "Complete" State.
classitems.name: currentOrderDidComplete

classitems.description:
A method called in the `spree-ember-checkouts` initializer after the
`Checkouts` mixin is applied to the Spree service, to initialize functionality
in this mixin.
classitems.name: _restoreCurrentOrder

classitems.description:
The token used to Authenticate the current user against the current order.  Persisted
to local storage via `spree-ember-core/mixins/storable`.  This property is
sent to the Spree server via the header `X-Spree-Order-Token`.
classitems.name: guestToken

classitems.description:
The user's Current Order number, persisted to local storage via
`spree-ember-core/mixins/storable`.  This property is sent to the Spree
server via the header `X-Spree-Order-Id`.
classitems.name: orderId

classitems.description:
A reference to the Current Order.  It is only set twice in this code,
once on Application initialization (in the case it was persisted), and once
when a new order is created through the internal method `_createNewOrder`.
classitems.name: currentOrder

classitems.description: A reference to the Stateful Checkouts service.
classitems.name: checkouts

classitems.description:
Adds a lineItem to the currentOrder. If there is no Current Order,
Spree Ember will request a new order from the server, and set it as the
Current Order on the Spree service.
classitems.name: addToCart

params.name: variant
params.description: A class of the variant model

params.name: quantity
params.description: Optional, A quantity for the Line Item.

return.description: A promise that resolves to the newly saved Line Item.

classitems.description:
An internal method for saving Line Items.  If it is called for a variant that
is already in the current order, it will add to the corresponding Line Item's
quantity, otherwise it will create a new Line Item for that variant.
classitems.name: _saveLineItem

params.name: variant
params.description: A class of the variant model

return.description:
A promise that resolves to the newly created or
updated `lineItem` object.

classitems.description:
Will attempt to create a new Order for the checkout user, and save the `orderId`
and `guestToken` to the Spree service, so that it will persist across page
refreshes.  It will also initiate the state machine for the current order.
classitems.name: _createNewOrder

return.description:
A promise that resolves to the newly created
Spree Order.

classitems.description: Clears the current order and any reference to it.
classitems.name: clearCurrentOrder

classitems.description:
By default, Ember's Active Model Serializer will merge the JSON payload
returned by the `serialize` call under the model's name.  The Spree
Checkouts endpoint expects objects as siblings in the payload, so when we're
saving the checkouts via `DS.Order#saveToCheckouts()` we override this 
behaviour.
classitems.name: serializeIntoHash

classitems.description: Serializes the Order into a format the Spree Checkouts endpoint expects.
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: snapshot
params.description: A snapshot of the order model for serialization.

classitems.description: A reference to the Stateful Checkouts service.
classitems.name: checkouts

classitems.description:
Serializes the Order into a format the Spree Checkouts endpoint expects, 
dependant on the state of Checkouts service.
classitems.name: _serializeForCheckouts

params.name: snapshot
params.description: A snapshot of the order model for serialization.

params.name: orderJSON
params.description: The regular JSON for the Order.

classitems.description:
Extracts the errors from an Invalid response from the Server.  Overrides the
default method to include a Top Level error from the payload as `base` in the
`DS.Errors` collection.
classitems.name: extractErrors

params.name: store
params.description: The ember store used for this request.

classitems.description:
Provided by Ember FSM, the current state of the checkout.  This will often
diverge from the `currentOrder.get('state')`, and will be reconsoidated when
the state machine calls `validateOrder`.  This is what we use as the 
cononical "state" for a frontend's Checkout flow.
classitems.name: currentState

classitems.description: A reference to the Spree Service.
classitems.name: spree

classitems.description: A reference to the Spree Object's `currentOrder`.
classitems.name: currentOrder

classitems.description: Used by Ember FSM to name the `initialState`.
classitems.name: fsmStates

classitems.description: Used by Ember FSM to describe the checkout flow.
classitems.name: fsmEvents

classitems.description:
Called whenever the State Machine enters "Address".  Ensures that an address
object exists for the order's `shipAddress`.
classitems.name: ensureShipAddressExists

classitems.description:
Called whenever the State Machine enters "Payment".  Ensures that a payment
and source object exists for the `currentOrder`.
classitems.name: ensurePaymentExists

classitems.description:
When `validateOrder` fails, the State Machine will automatically transition
to "failed".  Here, we listen to that transition, and then automatically
run this method, to reset the State Machine to the State of the 
`currentOrder`.

Note: Because Ember QUnit relies on returned promise for Unit tests, we 
disable this method in `test`, and manually reset the State Machine when
testing failed transitions.
classitems.name: _resetStateMachine

classitems.description:
If a state name is passed to this method, the state machine will attempt to
transition directly to that state.  If not, we will attempt to transition
to the next state in the checkout flow.
classitems.name: transition

params.name: stateName
params.description: Optional, a state to attempt transition to.

return.description:
A promise that resolves when the State Machine
resolves it's transition.

classitems.description:
Used to save changes to the `currentOrder` to Spree's Checkouts API.  Is only
called by the state machine when advancing to a later state in the flow.
classitems.name: validateOrder

return.description:
A promise that resolves when the server
response returns.
